verses.verse: Then went <WH3212> Samson <WH8123> to Gaza, <WH5804> and saw <WH7200> there <WH8033> an harlot, <WH2181> and went <WH935> in to her.

And it was told the Gazites, <WH5841> saying, <WH559> Samson <WH8123> is come <WH935> here. And they compassed <WH5437> him in, and laid wait <WH693> for him all <WH3605> night <WH3915> in the gate <WH8179> of the city, <WH5892> and were quiet <WH2790> all <WH3605> the night, <WH3915> saying, <WH559> In the morning, <WH1242> when <WH5704> it is day, <WH1242> we shall kill <WH2026> him.

And Samson <WH8123> lay <WH7901> till <WH5704> midnight, <WH2677> <WH3915> and arose <WH6965> at midnight, <WH2677> <WH3915> and took <WH270> the doors <WH1817> of the gate <WH8179> of the city, <WH5892> and the two <WH8147> posts, <WH4201> and went <WH5265> away <WH5265> with them, bar <WH1280> and all, <WH5973> and put <WH7760> them on his shoulders, <WH3802> and carried <WH5927> them up to the top <WH7218> of an hill <WH2022> that is before <WH5921> <WH6440> Hebron. <WH2275>
And it came <WH1961> to pass afterward, <WH310> <WH3651> that he loved <WH157> a woman <WH802> in the valley <WH5158> of Sorek, <WH7796> whose name <WH8034> was Delilah. <WH1807>

And the lords <WH5633> of the Philistines <WH6430> came <WH5927> up to her, and said <WH559> to her, Entice <WH6601> him, and see <WH7200> wherein <WH4100> his great <WH1419> strength <WH3581> lies, and by what <WH4100> means we may prevail <WH3201> against him, that we may bind <WH631> him to afflict <WH6031> him; and we will give <WH5414> you every <WH376> one <WH376> of us eleven <WH505> <WH3967> hundred <WH3967> pieces of silver. <WH3701>

And Delilah <WH1807> said <WH559> to Samson, <WH8123> Tell <WH5046> me, I pray <WH4994> you, wherein <WH4100> your great <WH1419> strength <WH3581> lies, and with which <WH4100> you might be bound <WH631> to afflict <WH6031> you.

And Samson <WH8123> said <WH559> to her, If <WH518> they bind <WH631> me with seven <WH7651> green <WH3892> thongs <WH3499> that were never <WH3808> dried, <WH2717> then shall I be weak, <WH2470> and be as another <WH259> man. <WH120>

Then the lords <WH5633> of the Philistines <WH6430> brought <WH5927> up to her seven <WH7651> green <WH3892> thongs <WH3499> which <WH834> had not been dried, <WH2717> and she bound <WH631> him with them.

Now there were men lying in wait, <WH693> abiding <WH3427> with her in the chamber. <WH2315> And she said <WH559> to him, The Philistines <WH6430> be on you, Samson. <WH8123> And he broke <WH5423> the thongs, <WH3499> as a thread <WH6616> of wick <WH5296> is broken <WH5423> when it touches <WH7306> the fire. <WH784> So his strength <WH3581> was not known. <WH3045>

And Delilah <WH1807> said <WH559> to Samson, <WH8123> Behold, <WH2009> you have mocked <WH2048> me, and told <WH1696> me lies: <WH3576> now <WH6258> tell <WH5046> me, I pray <WH4994> you, with which <WH4100> you might be bound. <WH631>

And he said <WH559> to her, If <WH518> they bind <WH631> me fast with new <WH2319> ropes <WH5688> that never <WH3808> were occupied, <WH6213> <WH4399> then shall I be weak, <WH2470> and be as another <WH259> man. <WH120>

Delilah <WH1807> therefore took <WH3947> new <WH2319> ropes, <WH5688> and bound <WH631> him therewith, and said <WH559> to him, The Philistines <WH6430> be on you, Samson. <WH8123> And there were liers in wait <WH693> abiding <WH3427> in the chamber. <WH2315> And he broke <WH5423> them from off <WH5921> his arms <WH2220> like a thread. <WH2339>

And Delilah <WH1807> said <WH559> to Samson, <WH8123> Till now <WH5704> <WH2008> you have mocked <WH2048> me, and told <WH1696> me lies: <WH3576> tell <WH5046> me with which <WH4100> you might be bound. <WH631> And he said <WH559> to her, If <WH518> you weave <WH707> the seven <WH7651> locks <WH4253> of my head <WH7218> with the web. <WH4545>

And she fastened <WH8628> it with the pin, <WH3489> and said <WH559> to him, The Philistines <WH6430> be on you, Samson. <WH8123> And he awaked <WH3364> out of his sleep, <WH8142> and went <WH5265> away <WH5265> with the pin <WH3489> of the beam, <WH708> and with the web. <WH4545>

And she said <WH559> to him, How <WH349> can you say, <WH559> I love <WH157> you, when your heart <WH3820> is not with me? you have mocked <WH2048> me these <WH2088> three <WH7969> times, <WH6471> and have not told <WH5046> me wherein <WH4100> your great <WH1419> strength <WH3581> lies.
And it came <WH1961> to pass, when <WH3588> she pressed <WH6693> him daily <WH3117> with her words, <WH1697> and urged <WH509> him, so that his soul <WH5315> was vexed <WH7114> to death; <WH4191>

That he told <WH5046> her all <WH3605> his heart, <WH3820> and said <WH559> to her, There has not come <WH5927> a razor <WH4177> on my head; <WH7218> for I have been a Nazarite <WH5139> to God <WH430> from my mother's <WH517> womb: <WH990> if <WH518> I be shaven, <WH1548> then my strength <WH3581> will go <WH5493> from me, and I shall become <WH2470> weak, <WH2470> and be like any <WH3605> other man. <WH120>

And when Delilah <WH1807> saw <WH7200> that he had told <WH5046> her all <WH3605> his heart, <WH3820> she sent <WH7971> and called <WH7121> for the lords <WH5633> of the Philistines, <WH6430> saying, <WH559> Come <WH5927> up this once, <WH6471> for he has showed <WH5046> me all <WH3605> his heart. <WH3820> Then the lords <WH5633> of the Philistines <WH6430> came <WH5927> up to her, and brought <WH5927> money <WH3701> in their hand. <WH3027>

And she made him sleep <WH3462> on her knees; <WH1290> and she called <WH7121> for a man, <WH376> and she caused him to shave <WH1548> off the seven <WH7651> locks <WH4253> of his head; <WH7218> and she began <WH2490> to afflict <WH6031> him, and his strength <WH3581> went <WH5493> from him.

And she said, <WH559> The Philistines <WH6430> be on you, Samson. <WH8123> And he awoke <WH3364> out of his sleep, <WH8142> and said, <WH559> I will go <WH3318> out as at other times <WH6471> before, <WH6471> and shake <WH5287> myself. And he knew <WH3045> not that the LORD <WH3068> was departed <WH5493> from him.

But the Philistines <WH6430> took <WH270> him, and put <WH5365> out his eyes, <WH5869> and brought <WH3381> him down <WH3381> to Gaza, <WH5804> and bound <WH631> him with fetters <WH5178> of brass; <WH5178> and he did grind <WH2912> in the prison <WH631> house. <WH1004>
However, the hair <WH8181> of his head <WH7218> began <WH2490> to grow <WH6779> again after <WH834> he was shaven. <WH1548>

Then the lords <WH5633> of the Philistines <WH6430> gathered <WH6908> them together for to offer <WH2076> a great <WH1419> sacrifice <WH2077> to Dagon <WH1712> their god, <WH430> and to rejoice: <WH8057> for they said, <WH559> Our god <WH430> has delivered <WH5414> Samson <WH8123> our enemy <WH341> into our hand. <WH3027>

And when the people <WH5971> saw <WH7200> him, they praised <WH1984> their god: <WH430> for they said, <WH559> Our god <WH430> has delivered <WH5414> into our hands <WH3027> our enemy, <WH341> and the destroyer <WH2717> of our country, <WH776> which <WH834> slew <WH2491> many <WH7235> of us.

And it came <WH1961> to pass, when <WH3588> their hearts <WH3820> were merry, <WH2896> that they said, <WH559> Call <WH7121> for Samson, <WH8123> that he may make us sport. <WH7832> And they called <WH7121> for Samson <WH8123> out of the prison <WH631> house; <WH1004> and he made them sport: <WH6711> and they set <WH5975> him between <WH996> the pillars. <WH5982>

And Samson <WH8123> said <WH559> to the lad <WH5288> that held <WH2388> him by the hand, <WH3027> Suffer <WH3240> me that I may feel <WH4184> the pillars <WH5982> whereupon <WH834> <WH5921> the house <WH1004> stands, <WH3559> that I may lean <WH8172> on them.

Now the house <WH1004> was full <WH4390> of men <WH582> and women; <WH802> and all <WH3605> the lords <WH5633> of the Philistines <WH6430> were there; <WH8033> and there were on the roof <WH1406> about three <WH7969> thousand <WH505> men <WH376> and women, <WH802> that beheld <WH7200> while Samson <WH8123> made sport. <WH7832>

And Samson <WH8123> called <WH7121> to the LORD, <WH3068> and said, <WH559> O Lord <WH136> God, <WH3069> remember <WH2142> me, I pray <WH4994> you, and strengthen <WH2388> me, I pray <WH4994> you, only <WH389> this <WH2088> once, <WH6471> O God, <WH430> that I may be at once avenged <WH5358> of the Philistines <WH6430> for my two <WH8147> eyes. <WH5869>

And Samson <WH8123> took hold <WH3943> of the two <WH8147> middle <WH8432> pillars <WH5982> on which <WH834> the house <WH1004> stood, <WH3559> and on <WH5921> which it was borne <WH5564> up, of the one <WH259> with his right <WH3225> hand, <WH3225> and of the other <WH259> with his left. <WH8040>

And Samson <WH8123> said, <WH559> Let me die <WH4191> with the Philistines. <WH6430> And he bowed <WH5186> himself with all his might; <WH3581> and the house <WH1004> fell <WH5307> on the lords, <WH5633> and on all <WH3605> the people <WH5971> that were therein. So the dead <WH4191> which <WH834> he slew <WH4191> at his death <WH4194> were more <WH7227> than they which <WH834> he slew <WH4191> in his life. <WH2416>

Then his brothers <WH251> and all <WH3605> the house <WH1004> of his father <WH1> came <WH3381> down, <WH3381> and took <WH5375> him, and brought <WH5927> him up, and buried <WH6912> him between <WH996> Zorah <WH6881> and Eshtaol <WH847> in the burial plot <WH6913> of Manoah <WH4495> his father. <WH1> And he judged <WH8199> Israel <WH3478> twenty <WH6242> years. <WH8141>
